_comment: English strings for datasheet templates. {variable} placeholders are replaced by the compile script with {{KEY}} bundler markers.
header_intro_scs: This datasheet is for version {version} of the Mozilla Common Voice *Scripted Speech* dataset for {english_name} (`{locale}`). The dataset contains {clips} clips representing {hours_recorded} hours of recorded speech ({hours_validated} hours validated) from {speakers} speakers, recorded from a text corpus of {total_sentences} sentences.
header_intro_sps: This datasheet is for version {version} of the Mozilla Common Voice *Spontaneous Speech* dataset for {english_name} (`{locale}`). The dataset contains {clips} clips representing {hours_recorded} hours of recorded speech ({hours_validated} hours validated) from {speakers} speakers.
demographics_intro: The dataset includes the following self-declared age and gender distributions. A coverage summary is shown below each table.
gender_intro: Self-declared gender information. The table shows clip and speaker counts with percentages. Speakers who did not declare a gender are listed as Unspecified. A dash (-) indicates zero.
age_intro: Self-declared age information. The table shows clip and speaker counts with percentages. Speakers who did not declare an age are listed as Unspecified. A dash (-) indicates zero.
sps_demographics_notice: We are working on adding demographic information to the Spontaneous Speech datasets. For the moment this information is not available.
data_splits_detail: The dataset contains {validated_clips} validated, {invalidated_clips} invalidated, and {other_clips} unresolved clips. The average clip duration is {avg_duration_secs} seconds.
text_corpus_detail: The corpus contains {total_sentences} sentences: {validated_sentences} validated and {unvalidated_sentences} unvalidated ({pending_sentences} pending review, {rejected_sentences} rejected), with {reported_sentences} reported for review.
sample_intro: There follows a randomly selected sample of five sentences from the corpus.
questions_intro: There follows a randomly selected sample of questions used in the corpus.
responses_intro: There follows a randomly selected sample of transcribed responses from the corpus.
fields_intro: Each row of a `tsv` file represents a single audio clip, and contains the following information:
scs_fields_list:
* `client_id` - hashed UUID of a given user
* `path` - relative path of the audio file
* `text` - supposed transcription of the audio
* `up_votes` - number of people who said audio matches the text
* `down_votes` - number of people who said audio does not match text
* `age` - age of the speaker[^1]
* `gender` - gender of the speaker[^1]
* `accents` - accents of the speaker[^1]
* `segment` - if sentence belongs to a custom dataset segment, it will be listed here
sps_fields_list:
* `client_id` - hashed UUID of a given user
* `audio_id` - numeric id for audio file
* `audio_file` - audio file name
* `duration_ms` - duration of audio in milliseconds
* `prompt_id` - numeric id for prompt
* `prompt` - question for user
* `transcription` - transcription of the audio response
* `votes` - number of people that who approved a given transcript
* `age` - age of the speaker[^1]
* `gender` - gender of the speaker[^1]
* `language` - language name
* `split` - for data modelling, which subset of the data does this clip pertain to
* `char_per_sec` - how many characters of transcription per second of audio
* `quality_tags` - some automated assessment of the transcription--audio pair, separated by `|`
   * `transcription-length` - character per second under 3 characters per second
   * `speech-rate` - characters per second over 30 characters per second
   * `short-audio` - audio length under 2 seconds
   * `long-audio` - audio length over 30 seconds
footnote_demographics: [^1]: For a full list of age, gender, and accent options, see the [demographics spec](https://github.com/common-voice/common-voice/blob/main/web/src/stores/demographics.ts). These will only be reported if the speaker opted in to provide that information.
